what: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: avesperu package opens door Peru’s extraordinary birds, encompassing dataset 1,901 species, highlighting status one world’s diverse bird-rich countries. comprehensive R package now leverages meticulously updated “List Birds Peru” M. . Plenge, revised expanded reflect latest data 06 - 03 - 2024. However, ’s important recognize avian taxonomy dynamic, undergoing significant changes time. species list adheres taxonomic classification endorsed South American Checklist Committee (SACC), assigns species codes reflecting various aspects residency status, endemism, migratory behavior, vagrancy, introductions, extirpation, hypothetical presence. now, SACC process recognizing certain subspecies full species, development inevitably alter species count. particular note, “H” category, representing hypothetical species, now holds fifth position South America’s ranking, following Argentina, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador. However, ranking may potentially decrease publication well-documented records, underscoring ongoing evolution refinement avian taxonomy.  Suggested citation:
code: citation("avesperu") #> To cite avesperu in publications use: #>  #>   Santos - Andrade, PE. (2024). avesperu: Access to the List of Birds #>   Species of Peru. R package version 0.0.2 #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {avesperu: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru}, #>     author = {Paul E. Santos - Andrade}, #>     year = {2024}, #>     note = {R package version 0.0.2}, #>   } #>  #> To cite the avesperu dataset, please use: Plenge, M. A. Version #> [06/03/2024] List of the birds of Peru / Lista de las aves del Perú. #> Unión de Ornitólogos del Perú: #> https://sites.google.com/site/boletinunop/checklist

title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru

title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: ’s quick example use avesperu package: package provides access list bird species recorded Peru also excels resolving potential typos variations species names fuzzy matching. ensures accurate retrieval intelligently recognizing accommodating slight discrepancies input names, making robust tool working diverse sometimes inconsistent datasets.
code: library(avesperu) #> This is avesperu 0.0.2  splist <- c("Falco sparverius",             "Tinamus osgodi",             "Crypturellus sooui",             "Thraupisa palamarum",             "Thamnophilus praecox")  search_avesperu(splist = splist, max_distance = 0.05) #>         name_submitted        accepted_name     english_name #> 1     Falco sparverius     Falco sparverius American Kestrel #> 2       Tinamus osgodi      Tinamus osgoodi    Black Tinamou #> 3   Crypturellus sooui    Crypturellus soui   Little Tinamou #> 5 Thamnophilus praecox Thamnophilus praecox  Cocha Antshrike #>          spanish_name         order         family    status dist #> 1 Cernícalo Americano Falconiformes     Falconidae Residente    0 #> 2        Perdiz Negra  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae Residente    1 #> 3        Perdiz Chica  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae Residente    1 #> 5     Batará de Cocha Passeriformes Thamnophilidae Residente    0 splist <- c("Falco sparverius",             "Tinamus osgodi",             "Crypturellus sooui",             "Thraupisa palamarum",             "Thraupisa palamarum",             "Thamnophilus praecox")  search_avesperu(splist = splist, max_distance = 0.05) #> The following names are repeated in the 'splist': Thraupisa palamarum #>         name_submitted        accepted_name     english_name #> 1     Falco sparverius     Falco sparverius American Kestrel #> 2       Tinamus osgodi      Tinamus osgoodi    Black Tinamou #> 3   Crypturellus sooui    Crypturellus soui   Little Tinamou #> 5 Thamnophilus praecox Thamnophilus praecox  Cocha Antshrike #>          spanish_name         order         family    status dist #> 1 Cernícalo Americano Falconiformes     Falconidae Residente    0 #> 2        Perdiz Negra  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae Residente    1 #> 3        Perdiz Chica  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae Residente    1 #> 5     Batará de Cocha Passeriformes Thamnophilidae Residente    0

title: aves_peru_2023 Dataset — aves_peru_2023
text: aves_peru_2023 dataset comprises tibble containing information regarding bird species documented Peru, sourced "List Birds Peru" compiled M. . Plenge 2023. encompasses various details, including scientific names, English names, Spanish names, order, family, status species.

title: aves_peru_2023 Dataset — aves_peru_2023
text: tibble 1,892 rows 6 columns: scientific_name Scientific name bird species. english_name English common name bird species. spanish_name Spanish common name bird species. order order bird species belongs. family family bird species belongs. status Status bird species (e.g., resident, endémic, migratory, etc.).

title: aves_peru_2023 Dataset — aves_peru_2023
text: dataset designed provide users comprehensive information avian species found Peru, documented M. . Plenge. organized easy access utilization within R environment.

title: aves_peru_2023 Dataset — aves_peru_2023
text: dataset based "List Birds Peru" M. . Plenge.

title: aves_peru_2024_v2 Dataset — aves_peru_2024_v2
text: aves_peru_2024_v2 dataset provides updated tibble bird species recorded Peru, based latest taxonomic revisions South American Checklist Committee (SACC).

title: aves_peru_2024_v2 Dataset — aves_peru_2024_v2
text: tibble 1,909 rows 6 columns: order_name Taxonomic order bird species belongs. family_name Taxonomic family bird species belongs. scientific_name Scientific name bird species. english_name English common name bird species. spanish_name Spanish common name bird species. status Category indicating species' status, based following codes: X - Resident species. E - Endemic species. NB - Migratory species. V - Vagrant species. - Introduced species. EX - Extirpated species. H - Hypothetical species.

title: aves_peru_2024_v2 Dataset — aves_peru_2024_v2
text: version incorporates significant taxonomic changes, new categories, updates derived recent publications, photographs, sound recordings archived accredited institutions. Total species: 1,909 Distribution status: X: 1,542 species E: 117 species NB: 138 species V: 83 species : 3 species EX: 0 species H: 26 species Species near Peru’s borders Ecuador, Colombia, Brazil, Chile included end list potential additions Peruvian bird inventory. updates reflect SACC's ongoing efforts evaluate recognize certain subspecies full species.

title: aves_peru_2024_v2 Dataset — aves_peru_2024_v2
text: Plenge, M. . (2024). Lista de las aves del Perú. Last updated: December 2, 2024. Unión de Ornitólogos del Perú.

what: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
text: function takes list birds species names, searches data avesperu pacakage dataset, returns data frame containing relevant information species.

title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
text: splist character vector containing names species search . max_distance maximum allowed distance fuzzy matching species names. Defaults 0.1.

title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
text: data frame containing retrieved information species.

title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
text: function allows fuzzy matching species names maximum distance threshold handle potential typos variations species names.

title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
code: splist <- c("Falco sparverius", "Tinamus osgodi", "Crypturellus sooui",             "Thraupisa palamarum", "Thamnophilus praecox")  search_avesperu(splist) #>         name_submitted        accepted_name    order_name    family_name #> 1     Falco sparverius     Falco sparverius Falconiformes     Falconidae #> 2       Tinamus osgodi      Tinamus osgoodi  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae #> 3   Crypturellus sooui    Crypturellus soui  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae #> 4  Thraupisa palamarum    Thraupis palmarum    Passeridae     Thraupidae #> 5 Thamnophilus praecox Thamnophilus praecox Passeriformes Thamnophilidae #>       english_name        spanish_name    status dist #> 1 American Kestrel Cernícalo Americano Residente    0 #> 2    Black Tinamou        Perdiz Negra Residente    1 #> 3   Little Tinamou        Perdiz Chica Residente    1 #> 4     Palm Tanager Tangara de Palmeras Residente    2 #> 5  Cocha Antshrike     Batará de Cocha Residente    0
